qas.question: Who is the current manager of the Everton Football Club?
How many caretaker managers have their been in the Everton FC's history?
Who was the Everton FC team's longest serving manager?
When did Harry Catterick manage the Everton Football Club?
Which Everton manager won the most domestic and international trophies during his time?
In what year did Roberto Martinez become the current manager of Everton?
In what year did Everton have its first caretaker manager?
Who has been Everton's shortest serving manager?
In what year did Howard Kendall win his first Division One Championship?
In what year did Howard Kendall earn his first Charity Shield?

context: Current manager, <a0_0>Roberto Martínez<a0_0/>, is the fourteenth permanent holder of the position since it was established in <b6_0>1939<b6_0/>. There have also been <a1_0>four<a1_0/> caretaker managers, and before 1939 the team was selected by either the club secretary or by committee. The club's longest-serving manager has been <a2_0>Harry Catterick<a2_0/>, who was in charge of the team from <a3_0>1961–73<a3_0/>, taking in 594 first team matches. The Everton manager to win most domestic and international trophies is <a4_0><b7_0>Howard Kendall<b7_0/><a4_0/>, who won two Division One championships, the <b8_0>1984<b8_0/> FA Cup, the <b5_0><b9_0>1984<b9_0/><b5_0/> UEFA Cup Winners' Cup, and three Charity Shields.
